summary: Few American homeowners were spared from the broad housing collapse a decade ago , but Generation Xers were hit particularly hard . Millennials , who were beginning to form households and accumulate wealth ( the oldest was only 26 in 2007 ) , were hit hard by the Great Recession in terms of employment and earnings , but not in terms of wealth destruction , as they had little wealth to lose .
